# Introduction

[Debian](https://www.debian.org/) is a free Linux operating system that is
related to Ubuntu. Most common hardware is supported. Get it
[**here**](https://www.debian.org/distrib/). Documentation is
[**here**](https://www.debian.org/doc/). Installation guides are
[**here**](https://www.debian.org/releases/stable/installmanual).

# Updates

## From the command line

See `man apt-get`.

```
apt-get update
apt-get upgrade
```

To update the distribution

```
apt-get dist-upgrade
```

# Admin tasks

## Add a user to sudo

From the command line:

1. Go to home directory by running command `cd -`

2. Type `su -`. It will ask you for password. Type your
login password you will be in root user.

3. Type `visudo`

4. Using the editor, add

   ```
   username        ALL=(ALL)      ALL
   ```

   to the sudoers file. Save (`write out`) and `exit`.
